item.title: Report X-2025011249
item.description:
Report X-2025011249

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-30
  • City: ARCADIA
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FIRST CLASS SERVICES, INCORPORATED
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 169100
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 12-30-2024 at 1420 hours central time I was notified by our driver that he had overturned his truck while pulling a load of Creosote. He was traveling south on Missouri Hwy 21, near Arcadia, MO, and when negotiating a left curve traveled partially off the west edge of roadway, onto a soft shoulder. In an attempt to regain control, he overcorrected, lost control and overturned onto the passenger side. The rear head fastened to the side wall of tanker (231) wall ruptured, causing more than 30,000 lbs. of material to leak onto the ground, and continued to leak for approximately five hours. The commodity being transported was Creosote, UN 3082 a Class 9 hazard. Emergency services, Pilot Knob Fire Protection District, Missouri Hwy Patrol, and Missouri DOT Hazmat Team (MDOTHT) arrived on scene. The Missouri state EPA was contacted, and I spoke with Sharon Kennedy and Greg Dillon informing them of all updates. I contacted the National Response Center (NRC) to report on the chemical spill and was provided an incident number (1420166). In addition, I was contacted by Liam Hazen, who is the disaster coordinator for the MODNR Environmental Emergency Response Section. He provided a list of hazardous material contractor cleanup teams. At approximately 1720 hours central I contacted Environmental Restoration LLC; an environmental clean-up team located near St Louis and spoke with their representative, William Lieneke, and he accepted the agreement to conduct the cleanup. Upon arriving on scene, William Lieneke made an evaluation and operated an excavator to build a berm to block the creosote from draining into a nearby stream. Lieneke has filed with the state to obtain the required permits to initiate the removal and disposal of the Creosote. At approximately 0149 hours Mr. Lieneke informed me he received authority from the state DNR representative to turn the truck and trailer from the side to the upright position. Trailer (231) was no longer leaking material due to hardening. At approximately 0410 hours the remaining Creosote was pumped off the damaged tanker (231) and onto a replacement tanker and truck. The remaining material was then transported back to the facility of origin, Omaha Track located in Granite City, Illinois.

item.title: Report X-2025011179
item.description:
Report X-2025011179

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD E DISCOVERED A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON THE INNER 5 GALLON JERRICAN APPEARED TO BE MISSING A RUBBER GASKET AND THE LID WAS UNABLE TO MAKE A WATERTIGHT SEAL WHICH RESULTED IN 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT ONTO THE FIBERBOARD CARTON.

item.title: Report X-2025011181
item.description:
Report X-2025011181

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE PD1 FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WEARING PPE AND SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. DAMAGED PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO SPILL TUB ALONG WITH CONTAMINATED DEBRIS. IT AND OTHER CONTAMINATED PACKAGES WERE TRANSPORTED TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025011009
item.description:
Report X-2025011009

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be open. While closing up the pacakge it was discovered that the contents could be dg. The package was then taken to the DG area and the DG agent researched the SDS on the manufactures website. There were no other markings on the package to indicate the shipment was DG. It was then determined this was an undeclared DG. Package is being held. .

item.title: Report E-2025010207
item.description:
Report E-2025010207

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from five (5) 1-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
